title: SoC CSD 458-0-20 Scientific Clinical Decision Making

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Exploration of current best evidence in making decisions about the assessment and treatment of individuals with communication disorders. Overview of different research methodologies as well as tools to evaluate the quality of different types of research studies. Emphasis on the integration of research evidence and critical thinking into practice.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
Upon successful completion of this course the student should be able to do the following:

1. Formulate answerable clinical research questions
2. Search for relevant sources of information to support assessment and treatment decisions
3. Critically appraise published clinically-relevant research across different methodologies, such as randomized controlled trials, single subject, correlational, and meta-analysis
4. Interpret the clinical significance of p-values, effect sizes, confidence intervals, regression and correlation coefficients within the context of clinically-relevant research articles
5. Critically appraise the psychometric properties of clinical assessments
6. Design clinically relevant and feasible research
7. Apply typical development and/or normative function data to inform treatment decisions
8. Collect and analyze data to evaluate treatment efficacy

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Class will involve lecture, discussion, and in-class activities.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Grades are based on five assignments and two in-class exams.
